sec.title: The Midwest Nursing Research Society Advances Science to Improve Health
sec.p: Have you ever wondered how decisions are made by the MNRS Board of Directors? Have you ever desired that your voice and opinions be heard by the MNRS Board of Directors? This is your chance to have your voice heard by taking the opportunity to explore a leadership position with the MNRS Board of Directors. There are a number of positions for which nominations will be sought in the near future to be placed on the ballot for the 2014 election. The open positions for 2014 include Vice President, Secretary, one Board Member at Large, and President-elect. Below is a brief description of the Board of Directors’ responsibilities, as well as the qualifications and responsibilities for the specific open Board positions.

sec.title: General Responsibilities of the Board of Directors

list-item.p: Directs the association based on the overall mission of MNRS.
Updates and approves strategic plans.
Develops and approves policies and procedures.
Exercises fiduciary responsibility by ensuring that MNRS finances are properly managed and by approving responsible budgets.
Oversees and evaluates MNRS programs to assure that committee objectives are being achieved.
Approves committee chairs and committee chairs’ recommendations for committee members.
Retains professional management, legal counsel, and independent auditor.
Conducts meetings that are open to all members to attend, except as otherwise announced.
Assists during membership recruitment and retention, when called upon by the membership committee.
Delegates the day-to-day management of the association to volunteer committees and staff.
Utilizes staff to assist in photocopying and mailing of all correspondence related to office.
Adheres to the financial policies set forth under the General Finance section of the MNRS Policies and Procedures Manual.
Turns over all official records to successors at the end of term.
Selects Annual Research Conference date and location.

sec.title: Executive Committee Responsibilities
sec.p: The executive committee comprises the elected officers of the Society: the president, president-elect, vice president, treasurer, and secretary.

list-item.p: Responsible for interim supervision of routine matters that arise between board meetings.
Oversees the financial management of the association. Develops short- and long-term financial plans for the association.
Reviews the preliminary budget developed by staff and makes the appropriate adjustments to reflect program priorities established by the board in the strategic plan prior to the June Board meeting.
Reviews the investment policy approved by the full board to ensure that it supports the financial goals of the association and makes recommendations for changes when necessary.
Sensitive to the fact that the management of the association is vested in the board and not the executive committee.

Qualifications
Holds an active membership in MNRS and is a member in good standing.
Is elected by the membership.

Responsibilities
Acts in the president’s stead and with the president’s powers in the absence of the president, or in the
case of the president’s inability to act.
Serves as a member of the executive committee.

sec.title: President-Elect (One-Year Term Prior to Assuming Presidency)

list-item.p:
Qualifications
Holds an active membership in MNRS and is a member in good standing.
Has current or previous experience as a member of the Board of Directors.
Is elected by the membership.

Responsibilities
Utilizes term of office to become familiar with the current issues of the society to prepare for the office of president.
Serves as a member of the executive committee.

Qualifications
Holds an active membership in MNRS and is a member in good standing.
Is elected by the membership.

Responsibilities
Ensures that proper record keeping practices are being followed.
Verifies that the minutes for each meeting are approved at the following meeting of the board.
Prepares the MNRS News material for the Western Journal of Nursing Research.
Serves as a member of the executive committee.

sec.title: Board Member at Large

list-item.p:
Qualifications
Holds an active membership in MNRS and is a member in good standing.
Is elected by the membership.

Responsibilities
As under Board of Directors.

sec.p: Note: All positions are a 2-year commitment except for president-elect who serves as 1 year in that specific role.

Dr. Janet Larson, Past President of MNRS serves as the Chair of the Nominations Committee. Voting will commence in early 2014. Election results will be publicly announced during the Business meeting at the annual MNRS Conference, which will be held in St. Louis, Missouri, March 27 to 30, 2014. For further information, review the details of each position on the MNRS website (www.mnrs.org) or contact Dr. Larson for additional information (janetlar@umich.edu).

Please review the position descriptions and then determine whether you or a colleague may ideally be suited for a leadership position within YOUR regional research society. Getting directly involved in MNRS is a great way to shape the future and direction of the organization.

Self-nominations may be considered; however, the policy on self-nominations is subject to change. Interested persons desiring to self-nominate for an open Board person should contact Kimberly Garland, MNRS Executive Director at:
Thank you for your interest in serving YOUR regional research society. MNRS is only as strong as its members, and their willingness to serve and support the organization.
Linda L. Chlan, PhD, RN, FAAN

sec.title: MNRS Foundation News
sec.p: In this month’s column, I want to highlight the names and contact information for the Foundation’s Board of Trustees. As President, I am very privileged to work with such a distinguished group of leaders and scholars who are devoted to supporting nursing research through their work on the Foundation Board. We are so lucky to have the Foundation’s first President, Sally Lusk, continue to share her wisdom and breadth of knowledge in her new capacity as Past President. We also recently welcomed Dean Roberta K. Olson as a Trustee, along with Marge Bott, our new MNRS Board Liaison. Board members are our greatest resource, putting in countless hours annually in support of the Foundation’s mission to advance research, research utilization, and research careers in the Midwest region. The Trustees listed below do so in many ways, such as helping to identify and solicit funds from corporate sponsors and MNRS members, working on FUNdraising ideas for the annual conference, and continuing to build the infrastructure for the Foundation by developing and revising (as needed) policies and procedures to guide the Foundation. In my last column, I identified the many ways by which MNRS members (and those outside the Society) may contribute to our fundraising efforts. Any of the Trustees named below would be happy to respond to inquiries about the various support mechanisms, to answer any concerns or questions you may have related to our mission and to receive and communicate your ideas for making our activities more effective. So please do not hesitate to contact us.
